a.n: A. Shepp "Swinging The Blues" - Jazz a La Villette

p.k: Archie Shepp's name has made it into the majority of jazz history books. Known for his explosive and free improvisations, the saxophonist pays tribute to the roots of the blues in Paris at Jazz a la Villette 2014.
p.d: Jazz a la Villette is an annual festival in Paris, France, dedicated to improvised music. While the festival's programme is always eclectic and diverse, the aim remains the same: to highlight the most innovative jazz artists of both the future and the past. The festival celebrates jazz history, often paying tribute to a particularly important year or an inspiring musician, while at the same time bringing the modern jazz of today. In 2014, veteran saxophonist Archie Shepp performed at Jazz a la Villette. Shepp's name has made it into the majority of jazz history books. Known for his explosive and free improvisations, the saxophonist now pays tribute to the roots of the blues.
